World Nuclear Newshttps://www.world-nuclear-news.org/?rss=feedWorld Nuclear News recent storiesen-GB
94ef4539-1427-4124-8636-13a320060616 More funding for Sizewell C preparationsThe UK government has made available a further GBP341 million (USD434 million) of previously allocated funding for development work on the Sizewell C nuclear power plant project in Suffolk, England. It said the extra money will help prepare the site for construction, procuring key components from the project's supply chain, and expanding its workforce. Wed, 30 Aug 2023 14:53:20 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/More-funding-for-Sizewell-C-preparations?feed=feed
ba958926-489d-4de6-8bbb-ddd82a4ba889 Court annuls licence for Texas used fuel storeThe licence issued for the construction and operation of a consolidated interim storage facility for used nuclear fuel in Texas has been cancelled by a US appeals court. The court ruled that the US Nuclear Regulatory Commission does not have the authority to license a private storage facility away from nuclear reactors. Wed, 30 Aug 2023 13:12:17 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Court-annuls-licence-for-Texas-used-fuel-store?feed=feed
996e9df9-abf4-4e32-98da-9570dba8eaca Atucha II returns to service after completing repairsArgentina's Atucha II nuclear unit is delivering power again after the successful completion of repairs prompted by the October 2022 inspection discovery that one of the four internal supports of the reactor had detached and moved from its design location. Wed, 30 Aug 2023 12:35:16 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Atucha-II-returns-to-service-after-unique-repairs?feed=feed
7dc93ca7-2a34-4c65-a2ea-5ee694ab2897 Westinghouse expands fuel offerings of Columbia plantWestinghouse has announced the creation of a centre of excellence for Low Enriched Uranium Plus fuel manufacturing at its Columbia Fuel Fabrication Facility in Hopkins, South Carolina. Tue, 29 Aug 2023 14:25:40 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Westinghouse-expands-fuel-offerings-of-Columbia-pl?feed=feed
39f8d9ba-ad93-4125-9d26-ff4747ccd83c Construction of Lufeng unit 6 beginsThe first safety-related concrete has been poured for the nuclear island of the unit 6 HPR1000 (Hualong One) at the Lufeng nuclear power plant in China's Guangdong province. It is the second HPR1000 under construction at the site, where four CAP1000s are also planned. Tue, 29 Aug 2023 12:23:23 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Construction-of-Lufeng-unit-6-begins?feed=feed
747f9714-f00a-441b-893a-8822da283311 Oklo and Centrus Energy broaden links with MoUAdvanced reactor plant developer Oklo has expanded its partnership with Centrus Energy with a memorandum of understanding covering the development of the Aurora powerhouses and High-Assay, Low Enriched Uranium fuel supply. Tue, 29 Aug 2023 13:34:04 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Oklo-and-Centrus-Energy-broaden-links-with-MoU?feed=feed
604fcbbc-2dce-4236-9b0a-2e530d49065a Saskatchewan seeks to develop SMR supply chainSaskatchewan's Crown Investments Corporation is providing CAD479,000 (USD352,296) to the Saskatchewan Industrial and Mining Suppliers Association and its partners to prepare local companies for their future participation in provincial, national and global small modular reactor development. Fri, 25 Aug 2023 14:01:54 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Saskatchewan-seeks-to-develop-SMR-supply-chain?feed=feed
bc9c191d-c419-447c-ba12-3576673d81e4 Xcel gets approval to expand used fuel storage at MonticelloThe Minnesota Public Utilities Commission has approved Xcel Energy's application to allow increased storage of used nuclear fuel at the Monticello nuclear power plant site, enabling the plant to operate for at least ten more years. The utility has applied to extend the plant's operating licence until 2050. Fri, 25 Aug 2023 12:16:29 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Xcel-gets-OK-to-expand-used-fuel-storage-at-Montic?feed=feed
a6f07c03-c87e-450f-b979-de7ccab8858c Orano completes first cut of Crystal River reactor vesselOrano USA has completed work to separate and pack the top third of the reactor vessel, with its embedded internal components, using its patented Optimized Segmentation process. The reactor vessel will be cut into three segments as the company carries out accelerated decommissioning of the plant. Thu, 24 Aug 2023 22:50:56 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Orano-completes-first-cut-of-Crystal-River-reactor?feed=feed
28f2cd2c-c43d-4a55-be8c-c1abbeb2e023 Slovenské elektrárne and Westinghouse fuel supply agreementA long-term agreement with Westinghouse for the licensing and supply of VVER-440 fuel assemblies has been signed as part of Slovenské elektrárne's efforts to diversify its supplies for power plants in Slovakia. Fri, 25 Aug 2023 11:59:49 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Slovenske-Elektrarne-and-Westinghouse-sign-fuel-su?feed=feed
b94221af-a487-46c8-8195-3012c74d4c7d Podcast: World Nuclear Performance ReportThe 2023 edition of <em>《世界核性能报告》充满了统计数据 - 其作者乔纳森·科布 (Jonathan Cobb) 介绍了头条新闻并讨论了调查结果揭示的有关总输出以及反应堆不同类型和寿命的信息。; Tue, 01 Aug 2023 08:37:29 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Podcast-World-Nuclear-Performance-Report?feed=feed
